data.title: Replays on bleed crash with an out-of-sync exception

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
some time during playback, not immediately at the start or end.

Edit: commit 5b61206
[This replay](https://seacloud.cc/d/5d1adbebce/files/?p=/ora_bug11660_replay_desync.orarep) desyncs in frame 4476.

data.title: [RA] Map uploaded in Resource Center, but lint check failed on all releases
data.body:
I've uploaded a Red Alert map called Four Districts in the Resource Center (http://resource.openra.net/maps/15071/), but unfortunately the lint check failed on all releases. It has been build with the Map Editor of release-20160508, but I've been finalizing it in the most recent OpenRA-bleed (Github)

How can I debug the map? How can I know what t02.husk is so I can remove it?

Lint check for release-20160508
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
Errors: 4

Lint check for release-20151224
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor t02.husk is not defined by any rule.
Errors: 4

Lint check for git-c2ec0d3
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Failed with exception: System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Unable to find parent package for /Web/openra/sites/resource.openra.net/www/openra/data/maps/15071/FourDistricts.oramap
at OpenRA.FileSystem.ZipFile..ctor (IReadOnlyFileSystem context, System.String filename) [0x00076] in /home/servers/servers/tmp/bleed/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/ZipFile.cs:64 
at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.OpenPackage (System.String filename) [0x00050] in /home/servers/servers/tmp/bleed/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/FileSystem.cs:47 
at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.CheckYaml.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) [0x00000] in :0

data.title: Add allies04
data.body:
As we don't support taking the map from the end of allies02 yet, I just added a "placeholder", trying to suggest that the base was attacked meanwhile and partly destroyed.

I also added soviet convoys that pass the area from time to time, to get some more action going. I thought it's a good idea as the whole thing is about securing the area for convoys.

data.title: Replaced Chocolatey with more reliable alternatives
data.body: TIL that NSIS is already pre-installed http://www.appveyor.com/docs/installed-software#tools and there is an API to render GFM using https://developer.github.com/v3/markdown/ getting rid of @chocolatey so we will hopefully get a more reliable Windows CI post compile.

data.title: Fixed AppVeyor failing at the MarkDown to HTML step
data.body: It looks like I accidentally regressed pandoc when caching NSIS in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11644. Let's see if this fixes the build.

data.title: Fixed a resource leak on OpenRA.Utility.exe --list-installshield-cab
data.body:
A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11536 after Coverity complained. This is probably not too significant.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11654/files?w=1 makes this easier to review.

data.title: Fixed a division through zero in DamagedByTerrain.
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11499 after Coverity complained about it.

data.title: Cannot move units
data.body:
Just installed OpenRA for the first time. Opened Singleplayer of Red Alert. Can select units, but using left-click won't move selected units.

Very possibly I'm missing something very simple...

data.title: Allow HealthInit to be used with Actor.Create in Lua scripts
data.body: BTW, I checked all the other `ActorInit`s, `HealthInit` was the only one without a single-argument ctor.

data.title: Resize infantry option
data.body:
one of the benefits of keeping out the foreign content (atleast in the infantry-area) is to have an option to actually switch between the 2 original RedAlert "Infantry-sizes" ... and let the individual players decide how he wants them to look like ... 

i thought this would be a nice feature though very mod-specific (sadly)

this would mean that we have to remove the sniper and the zombie completely ... also , that it would be harder to get new "none-ra-related" graphic-content into the mainmod 

so what this feature would do ... is "tighten up" the rule of keeping out none-cnc/ra-related content ... and help sealing the main-mods

i know theres people that dont like this idea because it would technically  steer in directions of being "less open" towards the Main-OpenRA mods (and graphic-content related) ... and a couple of people do love the sniper and zombies

however it would not interfere the openess of custom mods and maps

data.title: Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Mac.
data.body:
A New day. A New Build. A New Crash.

Game startup.

```
mono OpenRA.Game.exe Game.Mod=ra -debug                                                                                                                                                 255 ↵
Platform is OSX
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.

```

data.title: Artillery shells exploding under war factory
data.body:
Release-20160508.
Replay : https://filebin.net/w73silvd7ol48ttc @ 13:30 in the center of the map

Here you can see artillery shells exploding above the door of the war factory but under the war factory itself.

Fixes #11590.

Once you got used to it, it looks quite ok/good, imho.

data.body:
Release-20160508.
It happens when a game has just started.

data.title: Changed Basic and Combat observer stats to include Assets Destroyed/L…
data.body:
…ost instead of K/D ratio

Addressing #11628 and following @Mailaender 's suggestion

Since there was already a kill/death cost stat implemented, I relabeled it in the combat stats and replaced the K/D ratio in the basic stats with it.
This is what it shows now:
![assets](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7117676/16793516/72a43b7e-4886-11e6-8ed0-d18eab0760bc.png)

data.title: Cached the NSIS installation on AppVeyor CI
data.body: Following the advice of https://www.appveyor.com/docs/build-cache#caching-chocolatey-packages

data.title: Changing map reverts Map Options to default
data.body: Just a small detail :)

data.title: Convert ParticleDensityFactor from a float to an int
data.body: Split from #11573.

data.title: function reading actors command
data.body:
Adding a function reading out an actors commands and cpos destination of that command
example: Actor UnitWhatsDoing(string Command, Cpos target cell, target actor or nil)

data.title: Added sequence reference checks to OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.Traits.Render
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7709.

data.title: Deprecate terrain IsWater check - Part 1
data.body: This removes all remaining `IsWater` checks except for `CreateEffectWarhead`. The latter is better done in its own PR, because it would make sense to refactor `ImpactTypes` along with it, which might require some rather large upgrade rule and amount of yaml changes.

data.title: Fix the attack-move cursor appearing for units which can't attack-move
data.body:
Easily noticeable with tanya on the higher difficulties.
Fixes #9383.

data.title: Don't allow tanya to automatically target, but allow her to move within a attack-moving/guarding group

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: Guarding makes her kind of a walking turret as well (as did attack-move).

data.title: Change the 'Training' sound to 'Building' for all queues except Infantry
data.body: Fixes #11618.

data.title: Fixup DamagedByTerrain.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Depends on #11513.

Resolves #10091 and probably fixes #11383.

Closes #11720 as well.

data.title: Add an Image option to WithIdleOverlay.
Naval units cannot be ordered to move onto bridge tiles that are destroyed
data.body: They can move across them and stop on them. On release

data.title: Add curl as dependency for linux
data.body:
`make dependencies` fails if you don't have curl installed:
`./thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh: 105: ./thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh: curl: not found`

So I guess curl is a dependency. I already added it to the list on [the Compiling page on the wiki.](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Compiling). This adds the package names to INSTALL.md as well.
